metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15676 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Firefox sometimes ran the onload handler for SVG elements that the DOM sanitizer decided to remove, resulting in JavaScript being executed after pasting attacker-controlled data into a contenteditable element. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 81, Thunderbird < 78.3, and Firefox ESR < 78.3.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15676` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 81.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '81.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1').
